bioghist.p: The Samuels were a noted Jewish family in Philadelphia. David Samuel (1804-1881) and Esther (Hetty) Moss Samuel (1808-1867), were the parents of John Samuel (1829-1913) and Joseph Bunford Samuel (1853-1929). John Samuel was a prominent attorney and member of Congregation Mikveh Israel. His son, John D. Samuel (b. 1869) was married to Maria Amilla Robb (b. 1869). Their daughter Lois Samuel (b. 1902) donated the family's papers to the Athenaeum. Maria's parents were Maria A Burnett (1835-1903) and James M. Robb (1823-1899). William Moss (1831-1895) was a cousin of John Samuel. Members of the Levy family include Hayman Levy (1795-1865) and his wife, Almeria DeLeon Levy (1798-1882) and their children Rebecca Hendricks Levy Samuel (1832-1915), Julian Levy (c. 1834-1862), and Solomon B. Levy (1823-1865).

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers of the Samuel family of Philadelphia. There are also some papers of the Levy and Robb families. John Samuel materials include: letters; newspaper obituaries and memorials; published writings; and disbound scrapbooks assembled by Samuel. Scrapbooks include correspondence, published writings, Civil War and antebellum memorabilia, and newspaper clippings of letters to the editor from John Samuel about the inequality of the races and arguments for legal disenfranchisement of African-Americans. John D. and Millie Samuel materials include: correspondence; memorabilia; poetry; school papers; papers on Maria's family background (the Robbs); tintypes of Millie and her brother Harry; and a tintype of the Robb family. Other Millie materials include letters and newspaper clippings related to her political activities as a member of the Women's Democratic Committee and as appointee to a vacant Magistrate's seat by Governor Sproul in the early 1920s. Joseph Bunford Samuel materials include genealogical research and papers related to the publication of Records of the Samuel Family, and documentation related to his acquisition of the statue of Thorfinn Karlsefni in Fairmount Park. David and Esther Samuel materials include wills, stock certificates, cemetery records, and trust papers. Levy family materials include: wills and legal documents; family letters; letters from Julian and Solomon Levy written during their service in the Civil War; and life insurance certificates and receipts for slaves owned by the Levy family.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
